description.narrative:
Friends of Orphans is a local humanitarian actors coordinator a project that aims to enhance the the capacity if other selected humaniatrian actors in the district of Agago in Northern Uganda.In total there are 6 Local actors including the district localgovernment of Agago.The project strategies include identification and engagement of LNHA through creating spaces for LNHA to reflect on current capacity and to determine capacity development needs and options at District and National level. The projectis part of the campaign agenda to shift humanitarian assistance usually led by UN agencies and international NGOs to domestic actors which are usually perceived to lack, the skills, systems and financial resources needed to carry out effective response. Project Goal: To contribute to strengthening the capacity of District Local Governments and Local Non-Governmental Actors to respond to humanitarian action in Agago District of Northern Uganda. Project aims to realise the following: # Improved humanitarian planning and response of District Local Governments and Local Non-Governmental Actors to lead a strong domestic humanitarian agenda. # Increased access to information on humanitarian emergencies. Friends of Orphans will Manage the HCDF for theLNHAs as per agreed joint action plans in Agago District. The project targets up to 6 Local and National Humanitarian Actors in the District (Friends of orphans,WOSO,PCCO,FOKAPAWA,AVCT and Agago DLG and fullfills the bleow Objectves as developed in the Joint Action Plans; 1. Humanitarian actors operate under a common approach that links humanitarian with development(DRR, Resilience and Response) 2. Qualified Human Resources 3. Capable Humanitarian Structure 4.Humanitarian government structures and NGOsare able to respond to humanitarian crises timely and effectively, reaching all people in need
# Enhanced capacity of local actors to influence the central government, international NGOs and donors to endorse and fund local actors #humanitarian actioninitiatives.

participating-org.narrative:
Friends of Orphans (FRO) is a non-governmental organization (NGO) founded in 1999, based in northern Uganda in Pader district. It is dedicated to improving the lives of people living in post war Northern Uganda with a vision to have a society in which the vulnerable are empowered to achieve their full potential and contribute to the development of their community. Ricky Richard Anywar has used his child soldier expirences to found FRO. It is a fully registered non-for-profit NGO under registration number S 5914/5010. FRO works to rehabilitate reintegrate and empower those impacted by conflict and HIV/AIDS in Uganda. We do these through emergency responds, livelihood support programs, education, vocational training, peace building, HIV/AIDS, agribusiness and human rights programs. FRO has a range of staff from different education, academic and work experiences backgrounds as educators, administrators, social workers, human rights advocates, medical officers, environmentalists, and in other professional fields through university education and work experience. FRO is senstive in gender balance and mainstreeming, it employes both men and women with proven capabilities. 1. ACHIEVEMENTS FRO have expanded both programmatically and institutionally in thepast three years, programmatically we have expandedour areas of coverage from Agago and Pader districts to cover Kitgum and Lamwo districts benefiting over 5,000 people (both men andwomen). Institutionally we have revised and redesigned our web site toincrease more traffics, we have increased the number of volunteer staff and we have improved our fund raising strategies to attract more funding. The vocational skill training centre curriculum and syllabus has been revised to improve the quality of the training. 3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE Mission: The mission is to contribute to the empowerment, rehabilitation and reintegration of orphans, former abductees, child mothers, vulnerable women and child headed households through emergency respond, education, peace building, human rights advocacy, livelihood support and HIV/AIDS support programs. Institutional objectives: What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term? 1 -To improve effictive responds on emergency,incase of any disasters that will affect the communities in the areas we are working on. 2 # tocontribute towards rehabilitation, reintergration and empowerment of former abductees, child mothers, orphans, vulnerable women and child headed house holdsin Northern Uganda. 3 -To empower and improve on the life of former abductees, orphans, child mothers, vulnerable women and child headed households through educational support both formal and informal, vocational training skills and income generating activities. 4 -To improve the livelihood of war and HIV/AIDS affected communities by strengthening their food security through agribusiness promotion. 5 -To promote human rights and peace building in the war affected areas of Northern Uganda.
Field(s) of activity: Friends of Orphans works in the districts of Agago, Pader, Kitgum and Lamwo. We work in areas of emergency responds,livelihood support programs, education, vocational training, peace building, HIV/AIDS, agribusiness and human rights programs. Ourbeneficaries are war affected youth (both boys and girls), orphans, child mothers, person with disabilities, vulnarable persons andwar and HIV/AIDS affected communities. 4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING FRO works in Northern Uganda in the district ofAgago, Pader, Kitgumand Lamwo. These districts have been affected by war for over 23 years and are always pronged to natural disasters like floods, wild fire, draught, wild animals destroying crops and diseases. FRO works with both international and local NGOs and local governments.Local governments give building contracts and school supplies, like school uniforms and materials to current and former FRO students. They also provide employment to our trained students who prefer to join the work force rather than establish their own business. In the last, Pader local government NGOs assessment carried out on all 58 NGOs in both Pader and Agago districts, and FRO was selected as the 2nd best performing NGO after World Vision. FRO is unique in a scene that we are one of the oldest organisations in the district and all other organisations always come for program consultation and advice from us. Our programs are always crosscutting thegeneral population including ages and gender.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
